Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How has your week been?
Hi, Ellie! It was a mixed bag. I went to a club meeting, and it was... interesting.
Interesting? That sounds intriguing. Can you tell me more about it?
Well, I was really nervous at first, but I ended up talking to a couple of people. It was nice, but I still felt a bit out of place.
That’s a common feeling when you’re trying something new. It’s great that you pushed through and made an effort to connect!
Yeah, I guess it was better than I expected.
That’s a win! Did you feel any moments of connection with anyone there?
A little. There was one person I chatted with about a shared interest in movies.
That’s fantastic! Building connections can take time. How did you feel afterward?
I felt good! Like I did something for myself.
That’s a wonderful feeling. It sounds like you’re starting to break out of that rut. Have you thought about following up with that person?
I thought about it, but I’m not sure how to reach out.
You could send a simple message or even suggest grabbing coffee. It doesn’t have to be anything formal.
That sounds doable. I could try that.
Great! It’s all about taking small steps. Now, how has your sleep been this week?
It’s been a bit better! The sleep journal helped. I noticed I was worrying a lot about my finances before bed.
Classified_Subsection: Physiological Observations: History of Present Illness (HPI)

Utterance: That’s insightful! Recognizing those worries is the first step. Have you thought about how you might address those financial concerns?
I’ve been thinking I need to create a budget or something. It feels overwhelming, though.
It can be overwhelming, but breaking it down into smaller tasks can help. Would you like to set a goal to create a simple budget this week?
That sounds manageable. I can do that.
Perfect! Remember, it’s about progress. Now, let’s circle back to your feelings of loneliness. How have you been managing that?
I still have moments, but I’m trying to focus on the connections I’m building.
That’s a healthy approach. It’s about quality over quantity. Have you thought about reaching out to your uncle?
I haven’t, but that’s a good idea. I think I’ll call him this week.
That sounds like a great plan! Connecting with family can be very grounding. Is there anything else on your mind today?
No, I think we covered everything. Thanks for the support, Ellie.
You’re doing great work! I’m proud of you. Let’s check in next week on your progress.
Thanks, Ellie! Bye for now!
Bye! Take care!
